data.title: Tommy Savas
data.meta_description: Explore the filmography of Tommy Savas on Rotten Tomatoes! Discover ratings, reviews, and more. Click for details!
data.text: The origin of Tommy Savas's acting career goes back to when he was just 16 years old. His acting career began with roles in the series "The Sopranos" (2000), "Without A Trace" (CBS, 2002-09) and "Cold Case" (CBS, 2003-2010). He also appeared in "NCIS" (CBS, 2003-) and "CSI: New York" (CBS, 2004-2013). During the early stages of his acting career, Savas worked in films like the Campbell Scott comedic drama "Roger Dodger" (2002). Several more television roles followed in the early 2000s, including stints on "House" (2004-2012), "Shark" (CBS, 2006-08) and "The New Adventures of Old Christine" (CBS, 2006-2010). He also appeared in "Raising the Bar" (2008-09), "Castle" (ABC, 2009-2016) and "Justified" (FX, 2010-15). More recently, he tackled roles on "Prime Suspect" (2011-12), "Hollywood Heights" (2012) and "State Of Affairs" (NBC, 2014-15). He also appeared in "The Last Ship" (TNT, 2014-) and "Stitchers" (Freeform, 2015-17). He also appeared in the thriller "The Moment" (2014) with Jennifer Jason Leigh. Most recently, Savas voiced characters in "Voltron: Legendary Defender" (2015-).
